entry.title: Vite report on Sun, 19 Nov 2023 20:02:22
entry.summary:
Tech:
- Meta splits Responsible AI team between generative AI and AI infrastructure
- OpenAI's internal drama unfolds as investors and employees push for Altman's return
- Elon Musk became so paranoid he banned meetings of more than 2 Twitter employees, fearing mutiny or sabotage, author says
- See inside Nvidia's giant 'Voyager' HQ — a futuristic office where work meets nature
- Unlocking Efficiency: A Deep Dive into Redis as an In-Memory Datastore

- OpenAI’s custom GPTs: Everything you need to know about how to use them and build your own

- Boeing 787 capable of carrying 300 passengers lands in Antarctica in world first
- Meta Unveils Emu Video and Emu Edit: Pioneering Advances in Text-to-Video Generation and Precision Image Editing
- London’s O2 Will Host The ‘League Of Legends’ Worlds Final In 2024

Business:
- Baby boomers got rich off real estate and they are in perfect position to do it again
- Airlines will make a record $118 billion in extra fees this year—their websites are designed to get you to pay
- Used car prices are finally falling. Here are 6 tips to help make sure you don't pay too much.
- LinkedIn tried censorship against me in the worst possible way. No More Joke.

Insights:
- The tech industry is experiencing internal drama and leadership changes, particularly in companies like Meta and OpenAI.
- AI is being used in various fields, including generative AI for governing and text-to-video generation.
- Business trends include the rise of extra fees in the airline industry and falling used car prices.
- College football and sports achievements are also highlighted.
- Other topics range from obituaries to political statements and scientific developments.
